content: in a legal case in estonia a final resolution was reached in tartu county court the defendant did not respond to the courts decision resulting in a default judgment against them the defendant has the right to appeal this decision within 30 days the defendant must file a statement of defense provide necessary documents and evidence and pay a state fee to the ministry of finance the case involves the division of joint property between two parties the claimant is requesting the court to determine the market value of the disputed property through an experts report the claimant can appeal the courts decision within 30 days and may request procedural assistance from the court they are asking for the jointlyowned apartment building to be sold at a public auction and the proceeds divided between the parties the claimant also wants to replace the parties declarations of intent to terminate the coownership agreement the court has sent the application materials to the defendant and received a response the court has confirmed receipt of the claim and made followup requests to serve documents to the defendant the court ordered the claimant to provide additional information to obtain the defendants contact details the claimant was unable to obtain the defendants contact details and the court determined that the documents should be served through an open court the defendant has 20 days to respond to the claim but they did not respond within the deadline the court considers the claim accepted and issues a default judgment the court determines the division of joint assets between the parties and orders the sale of the jointlyowned property through auction the court terminates the joint ownership of the disputed apartment and grants the claimants request for the proceeds to be shared jointly and severally the claimants request for an experts report to determine the starting price for the auction is rejected the court explains the process for determining the starting price of a property obtained through auction the court dismisses the claimants application to replace the parties declarations of intent to terminate coownership the disputed apartment is sold at a public auction and the defendant is obliged to make a declaration of intent the court orders the defendants share of the sale price to be deposited into a notarys account the court determines that the default judgment is immediately enforceable without guarantee and notes the distribution of procedural costs in the judgment both parties are ordered to bear the costs the apportionment of costs can be challenged on appeal
